name: vscode-swf-debug
description: Debug your SWF files in Adobe AIR or Flash Player

platform.description: Installs the Adobe AIR application on the specified platform and launches it before attaching to the debugger.

connect.description: Indicates if the debugger should connect to the runtime instead of listening. May be used for USB debugging on mobile.

platformsdk.description: An optional path to the platform SDK for the target device.

port.description: (Advanced) If the "connect" attribute is true, the debugger will connect on the specified port.

applicationID.description: (Advanced) Override the Adobe AIR application ID used to uninstall and launch on an mobile device. Must also specify the appropriate "platform" value.

bundle.description: (Advanced) Override the path to .apk or .ipa file to install on a mobile device. Must also specify the appropriate "platform" value.

program.description: Absolute path to a SWF or AIR application descriptor XML. If omitted, will attempt to detect program automatically.

profile.description: The device profile to use in AIR Debug Launcher.

args.description: Optional arguments to pass to the AIR application.

screensize.description: Defines the screen dimensions when running with the mobileDevice profile in AIR Debug Launcher

screenDPI.description: Overrides the value returned by Capabilities.screenDPI in the AIR Debug Launcher.

versionPlatform.description: Overrides the three characters returned by Capabilities.os in the AIR Debug Launcher.

runtimeExecutable.description: Path to runtime executable, such as the standalone version of Adobe Flash Player, a web browser, or AIR Debug Launcher.

runtimeArgs.description: Optional arguments to pass to the runtime executable.

extdir.description: Path to directory containing unpackaged AIR native extensions for debugging. Relative paths are based on workspace root.

rootDirectory.description: (Advanced) Specifies the root directory of the application to run. If not specified, the directory containing the application descriptor file is used.

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Launch Standalone SWF
configurationSnippets.description: Launch SWF in standalone Adobe Flash Player executable

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Launch SWF embedded in HTML
configurationSnippets.description: Launch SWF embedded in HTML in a web browser

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Launch Adobe AIR desktop
configurationSnippets.description: Launch Adobe AIR desktop application using AIR Debug Launcher

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Launch Adobe AIR mobile simulator
configurationSnippets.description: Launch Adobe AIR mobile application using AIR Debug Launcher

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Attach SWF
configurationSnippets.description: Attach to Adobe AIR or Flash Player that was launched externally

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Install & Attach Adobe AIR (iOS)
configurationSnippets.description: Install and attach to Adobe AIR on iOS device

configurationSnippets.label: SWF: Install & Attach Adobe AIR (Android)
configurationSnippets.description: Install and attach to Adobe AIR on Android device
